Class ATMServerProtocol

java.lang.Object
  ATMServerProtocol

public class ATMServerProtocol
extends java.lang.Object

The ATMServerProtocol class deals with a processes data received from the client and updates the data base file and sends data to the atm client. This class is called from the ATMServerThread class which is passed to this class as a parameter in which this class refers to. This class does the majority of the processing work done by the server side of the ATM System

Author:
Jamie Brindle (06352322)

Method Detail

processInput

public void processInput(java.lang.String fromClient)
Processes the input from the client and sends messages/data to the client and updates the account database

Parameters:
fromClient - the message/data received from the client in the form of a string

isAccountActive

public boolean isAccountActive()
Method to determine if the present account is already active on the server by looking through the activeAccounts array list brought from the ATMServerThread class, which in turn was brought in by the ATMServer class

Returns:
true if account active, false otherwise

removeFromActiveAccounts

public void removeFromActiveAccounts()
Method to remove the account presently dealing with from the active accounts array list which originally resides from the ATMServer class

getAccountInfoPDU

public java.lang.String getAccountInfoPDU()
Method to get specific data from the account pointed to by the store and assign to variables to allow an AccountInfoPDU string to be generated which will be sent to the client

Returns:
outputString the AccountInfoPDU

getData

public java.lang.String getData(java.lang.String aString)
Separates the data from the PDU identifier and returns only the first or only piece of data

Parameters:
aString - The PDU String
Returns:
items[1] The first or only piece of data (String)

splitString

public java.lang.String[] splitString(java.lang.String aString)
Similar to the getData method. It splits the pieces of data from the PDU identifier but instead of returning a single String, it returns an Array of all the pieces of data in the PDU, This is used when more than one item of data is expected

Parameters:
aString - The PDU String
Returns:
items An array of data items

updateWithdrawalLimits

public void updateWithdrawalLimits(java.lang.String withdrawelLimitsPDU)
Takes the input from the client, separates the data and updates the date last withdrawn in account field and the amount withdrawn today field

Parameters:
withdrawelLimitsPDU - the input from the client (string) containing the withdrawal limits data

updateBalanceFromWithdrawal

public void updateBalanceFromWithdrawal(java.lang.String withdrawelPDU)
Updates the balance, amount withdrawn today and date last withdrawn account fields from the data in the withdrawalPDU string from the input from the client It also adds a withdrawal transaction in the accounts transaction array list

Parameters:
withdrawelPDU - the input from the client (string) containing the withdrawal amounts

updateBalanceFromDeposit

public void updateBalanceFromDeposit(java.lang.String depositPDU)
Updates the balance, amount withdrawn today and date last withdrawn account fields from the data in the depositPDU string from the input from the client It also adds a deposit transaction in the accounts transaction array list

Parameters:
depositPDU - the input from the client (string) containing the deposit amounts

getDateFormat

public java.lang.String getDateFormat(java.lang.String dateString)
Formats the data from a long number into a readable data format

Parameters:
dateString - the long number in the form of a string of the date to be formatted
Returns:
dateString the formatted date in the form of a readable date string

accountExists

public boolean accountExists(java.lang.String theAccountNo)
Iterates through the account array list in the store to determine if a particular account exists for the purpose of retrieving the account information

Parameters:
theAccountNo - the entered account number input from the client return boolean true if account exists, false otherwise
